content:
Certainly, here is a five-day meal plan for someone unskilled in preparing food using ingredients easily found in a Norwegian grocery store such as Rema 1000. Each day has breakfast, lunch, dinner, and an evening snack, and no meal except dinner should take more than 8 minutes to prepare. I have tried to limit the number of different ingredients and reuse them where possible to make shopping easier.

Day 1:

* Breakfast: Greek yogurt with honey and granola
* Lunch: Ham and cheese sandwich with carrot sticks
* Dinner: Chicken stir-fry with frozen vegetables, served with rice
* Evening snack: Apple slices with peanut butter

Shopping list for Day 2:

* Greek yogurt
* Honey
* Granola
* Bread
* Ham
* Cheese
* Carrots
* Pre-cooked chicken
* Frozen stir-fry vegetables
* Rice
* Apples
* Peanut butter

Day 2:

* Breakfast: Oatmeal with banana and cinnamon
* Lunch: Grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup
* Dinner: Baked salmon with roasted vegetables, served with boiled potatoes
* Evening snack: Dark chocolate square

Shopping list for Day 3:

* Oatmeal
* Bananas
* Cinnamon
* Bread
* Cheese
* Tomato soup
* Salmon fillet
* Pre-cut vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots)
* Potatoes
* Dark chocolate

Day 3:

* Breakfast: Peanut butter and banana smoothie
* Lunch: Ham and cheese wrap with carrot sticks
* Dinner: Beef stir-fry with frozen vegetables, served with rice
* Evening snack: Grapes

Shopping list for Day 4:

* Bananas
* Peanut butter
* Tortilla wraps
* Ham
* Cheese
* Carrots
* Beef strips
* Frozen stir-fry vegetables
* Rice
* Grapes

Day 4:

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with toast
* Lunch: Chicken Caesar salad (use pre-cooked chicken and Caesar dressing)
* Dinner: Pork chops with roasted vegetables, served with boiled potatoes
* Evening snack: Clementine

Shopping list for Day 5:

* Eggs
* Bread
* Lettuce
* Pre-cooked chicken
* Caesar dressing
* Pork chops
* Pre-cut vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots)
* Potatoes
* Clementines

Day 5:

* Breakfast: Yogurt with mixed berries and honey
* Lunch: Chicken quesadilla (use pre-cooked chicken and pre-shredded cheese)
* Dinner: Beef stir-fry with frozen vegetables, served with rice
* Evening snack: Dark chocolate square

Shopping list for next week:

* Greek yogurt
* Honey
* Granola
* Bread
* Ham
* Cheese
* Carrots
* Pre-cooked chicken
* Frozen stir-fry vegetables
* Rice
* Apples
* Peanut butter
* Oatmeal
* Bananas
* Cinnamon
* Tomato soup
* Salmon fillet
* Pre-cut vegetables (such as broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots)
* Potatoes
* Beef strips
* Lettuce
* Caesar dressing
* Pork chops
* Tortilla wraps
* Pre-shredded cheese
* Mixed berries
* Clementines
* Dark chocolate

Note: All cooking times may vary depending on individual equipment and skill level.
